name: Free Test Subject
//: This quest shouldn't be given by random wandering NPCs, obviously. Right now SECONDARY is okay since it just means the dialog will be loaded but wandering NPCs won't ever have it.

dialogue.describe: Oh my God, a survivor! Please, help get me out of here!
dialogue.accepted: Thank you so much! Please hurry...
dialogue.advice: There's a computer in this room that controls the door locks on the cells. Maybe it's still working?
dialogue.inquire: Have you found a way to open the doors?
dialogue.success: Thank God! I'd have starved in there if you hadn't come by.
dialogue.//: Failure and lying don't apply in this case, as the mission giver is also the person to be rescued.
dialogue.success_lie: (if you ever see this, it's a bug)
dialogue.failure: (if you ever see this, it's a bug)

dialogue.describe: <swear_surprise> I thought I'd never see anyone else alive down here. Can ya' spare a minute for a fella' down on his luck, <name_g>?
dialogue.offer: <swear> pigs got me a few years ago for... eh, on second thought, it's not really important, heh heh. Anyways, as ya' can see, when everything went to shit, I couldn't do nothin' to get myself out. Those <swear> security bots shot up most of the place, but I guess they missed me. I got nothin' to work with in here, can ya' get me out, pal?
dialogue.accepted: Thanks, <name_g>. I'll find a way to repay ya', heh heh.
dialogue.rejected: <incredulous> You <swear> <name_b>, if I make it out of here you're <very> fucked.
dialogue.advice: Eh, maybe... pick the lock? Cut through the <swear> bars? You look like a smart fella', you'll figure somethin' out.
dialogue.inquire: You found a way to bust me out of this <swear> cell, bud? I'm <very> sick and tired of bein' <swear> stuck in here!
dialogue.success: Good work there, <name_g>. If you hadn't walked in just then I'd have <swear> starved... not really a fightin' man's way to go, if you catch my drift? Heh heh.
dialogue.success_lie: (if you ever see this, it's a bug)
dialogue.failure: (if you ever see this, it's a bug)
dialogue.//: Failure and lying don't apply in this case, as the mission giver is also the person to be rescued.
